alert.note: Alert for Greene; Wayne (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 03 at 2:51PM CST until February 03 at 5:45PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Greene County in southeastern Mississippi... Southeastern Wayne County in southeastern Mississippi... * Until 545 PM CST. * At 251 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... State Line, Buckatunna, Old Avera, Smithtown, Piave, Bothwell, Clark, Knobtown, Sand Hill, Avera, Jonathan, Battles, Byrd, Eret, Chicora, Neely and Belmont. This includes the following streams and drainages... Griffin Creek, Horse Creek, Cooper Creek, Escatawpa River, Fivemile Creek, Beaver Run, Patrick Creek, Skull Creek, Chickasawhay River, Long Branch, Johnson Creek, Hell Hole Creek, Little Red Creek, Big Oktibee Creek, Gunstock Branch, Gaines Creek, Waterfork Branch, Indian Camp Creek, Hall Branch, Brushy Creek, Indian Creek, Leaf River, Picayune Creek, Bull Branch, Davis Creek, Wolf Branch, Piney Woods Creek, Okey Branch, Morgan Mill Branch, Wooton Creek, Crawford Creek, Bear Creek, Turkey Creek, Big Creek, Snell Creek, Buckatunna Creek, Dry Creek, Mongus Creek, Little Creek, Gator Branch, Byrd Creek, McSwain Branch, Mill Creek, Cary Creek, Granny Branch, Newcomb Branch, Mason Creek, Atkinson Creek, Givens Branch, Sand Hill Creek, Little Gaines Creek, East Mason Creek, Robertson Creek, Panther Branch and Pine Log Branch. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
